intro: Zschokkea monosperma, commonly known as the African star orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pale green or white with a distinctive yellow center, and it produces a single seed per capsule, which is reflected in its scientific name. Zschokkea monosperma is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
